column5: Too busy to stop to eat. Not only urbanites eat on the go I guess.
Very cool. Is that from hamilton harbor?
No. Like I said I got the picture off another forum. We do have a pair here and we get a bunch that stop for a few days in March before heading north across the lake.
awesome image!!! i wasnt aware there was another forum..
So you CAN eat carp!
thats one of the best shots I have ever seen..amazing
good thing he didnt have a cell phone in the other hand...
That is an excellent shot!!
Great the secrets out... My Nations Great Symbol The American Bald Eagle eats carp why couldn't it have been at least a Bass....   Art
Art, I had a close look at that picture.  The tail is too forked, it's a splake not a carp.
what a crazy picture...thanks for sharing
Thank goodness thanks for helping me save face.That was a close one...   Art
Multi-tasking, I like that
Now if we could just increase the Bald Eagle population....
amazing pic
Maybe you guys should switch to the osprey as it seems to have much more refined tastes. Koi can cost tens of thousands of dollars.
That's not a Koi. It's an Aurora trout in full spawning colours.
My buddy Bottombouncer often tells the story fishing a quarry pond last year he saw a bald eagle dive and take off with like a 6lb carp in it's yap. Cool pic !
Awesome shot

Cool pic.  I remember one day sitting on the riverbank not catching anything when we saw an osprey land in a dead tree across the river from us. He sat up there for a bit then, all of a sudden, he swooped down into the river with a big splash and then comes up with a 1 or 2 lb.  fish (looked like a sucker). Then!! He flew right by us, about twenty feet away, holding this fish in his claws and looking me right in the eye. I swear he was sticking his tongue out at me.

We have a Osprey nesting box right above our dock.. They truely are amazing birds. I wish I had a better lens for my DSLR..the Kawartha Osprey are truely one of natures beautifull sights. If your ever in Havelock go to marions bait and tackle. He has a mounted and stuffed Golden eagle he caught in a fox snare in the early 70's over the worm fridge..That bird is HUGE.  <iframe title="YouTube video player" width="480" height="390" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/i-zXmydeI9A" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
My nations' great symbol eats bark ...
Them Americans will eat anything...
